remarks: A supremum is the least upper bound.  See also ~ supcl and ~ supub . (Contributed by NM, 13-Oct-2004.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 24-Dec-2016.)
statement:
supmo.1 $e |- ( ph -> R Or A ) $.
supcl.2 $e |- ( ph -> E. x e. A ( A. y e. B -. x R y /\ A. y e. A ( y R x -> E. z e. B y R z ) ) ) $.
suplub $p |- ( ph -> ( ( C e. A /\ C R sup ( B , A , R ) ) -> E. z e. B C R z ) ) $.
$d A x y z $.
$d B x y z $.
$d C z $.
$d R x y z $.
